summary.overview: The Online Quiz Portal allows users to participate in a quiz by answering multiple-choice questions. Users can navigate through questions, select answers, and view their final score at the end of the quiz.
summary.external_resources: No external resources are explicitly mentioned in the provided code.
summary.external_js_libraries: No external JavaScript libraries are explicitly mentioned in the provided code.

requirement.description: When the user accesses the Online Quiz Portal webpage, the system must display an h1 element with the text 'Online Quiz Portal', an h2 element with the text 'What is the capital of France?' (data-testid: 'question'), a div (data-testid: 'options') containing four radio button options ('Berlin', 'Madrid', 'Paris', 'Lisbon', each with type 'radio', name 'option', and their respective data-testids: 'option-0' to 'option-3'), and a button labeled 'Next Question' (data-testid: 'next-button').

test_case:
Feature: Display Initial Page of Online Quiz Portal
  The purpose of this feature is to ensure that when a user accesses the Online Quiz Portal, the system correctly displays the title and the first question with its options.


  Scenario: [Normal] User accesses the Online Quiz Portal
    Given the user navigates to the Online Quiz Portal webpage
    Then the system displays the title "Online Quiz Portal"
    And the system displays the first question "What is the capital of France?" with its options
    And the options displayed are "Berlin", "Madrid", "Paris", "Lisbon"

requirement.description: When the user views a question on the Online Quiz Portal page, the system displays the current question text in the <h2> element (data-testid: 'question'). Initially, it shows 'What is the capital of France?'. After the user clicks the button (data-testid: 'next-button'), the question updates to 'What is 2 + 2?', and after another click, it updates to 'What is the largest ocean on Earth?'.

test_case:
Feature: Displaying Questions in the Online Quiz Portal
  The system should display the text of the current question in the <h2> element with ID "question" when the user views a question.


  Scenario: [Normal] Display the first question
    Given the Online Quiz Portal page is loaded
    When the user views the question displayed in the <h2> element with data-testid "question"
    Then the system displays "What is the capital of France?" in the <h2> element with data-testid "question"

Feature: Displaying Questions in the Online Quiz Portal
  The system should display the text of the current question in the <h2> element with ID "question" when the user views a question.


  Scenario: [Normal] Display the second question after clicking Next
    Given the Online Quiz Portal page is loaded
    And the user views the question displayed in the <h2> element with data-testid "question"
    When the user clicks the button with data-testid "next-button"
    Then the system displays "What is 2 + 2?" in the <h2> element with data-testid "question"

Feature: Displaying Questions in the Online Quiz Portal
  The system should display the text of the current question in the <h2> element with ID "question" when the user views a question.


Scenario: [Normal] Display the third question after clicking Next twice
    Given the Online Quiz Portal page is loaded
    And the user views the question displayed in the <h2> element with data-testid "question"
    When the user clicks the button with data-testid "next-button"
    And the user clicks the button with data-testid "next-button" 
    Then the system displays "What is the largest ocean on Earth?" in the <h2> element with data-testid "question"

requirement.description: When the user accesses the 'Online Quiz Portal' page, the system dynamically generates answer options for the current question, displaying them as radio buttons within the <div> element (data-testid: 'options'). Each option is a radio input with a unique value matching the option text, a label showing the text, and a shared name attribute 'option' to allow single selection. The system updates the radio buttons for each question based on the quizData array.

test_case:
Feature: Display of Answer Options as Radio Buttons
  The system should dynamically generate and display radio buttons for each answer option when the user views a question.


  Scenario: [Normal] Display radio buttons for answer options
    Given the "Online Quiz Portal" page is loaded
    When the user views the question "What is the capital of France?"
    Then the system should display radio buttons for the options "Berlin", "Madrid", "Paris", and "Lisbon" within the <div> element with data-testid "options"

requirement.description: The Online Quiz Portal must allow users to select one answer per question using radio buttons within the <div> element (data-testid: 'options'). Each radio button has a unique data-testid in the format 'option-{index}', and no option is selected by default. When the user clicks a radio button, it becomes selected while any previous selection is cleared.

test_case:
Feature: Answer Selection in Online Quiz Portal
  The feature ensures that when a user selects an answer option, the system correctly marks the selected radio button as checked.


  Scenario: [Normal] User selects an answer option
    Given the "Online Quiz Portal" page is loaded
    And the first question "What is the capital of France?" is displayed with options "Berlin", "Madrid", "Paris", "Lisbon"
    When the user clicks on the radio button for the option "Paris" with data-testid "option-2"
    Then the radio button for the option "Paris" should be marked as checked

Feature: Answer Selection in Online Quiz Portal
  The feature ensures that when a user selects an answer option, the system correctly marks the selected radio button as checked.


  Scenario: [Edge] User selects an answer option and changes selection
    Given the "Online Quiz Portal" page is loaded
    And the first question "What is the capital of France?" is displayed with options "Berlin", "Madrid", "Paris", "Lisbon"
    When the user clicks on the radio button for the option "Berlin" with data-testid "option-0"
    And the user clicks on the radio button for the option "Paris" with data-testid "option-2"
    Then the radio button for the option "Berlin" should not be marked as checked
    And the radio button for the option "Paris" should be marked as checked

Feature: Answer Selection in Online Quiz Portal
  The feature ensures that when a user selects an answer option, the system correctly marks the selected radio button as checked.


  Scenario: [Error] User attempts to select an answer option without clicking
    Given the "Online Quiz Portal" page is loaded
    And the first question "What is the capital of France?" is displayed with options "Berlin", "Madrid", "Paris", "Lisbon"
    When the user does not click any radio button
    Then no radio button should be marked as checked

requirement.description: After the user selects an option and clicks the <button> (data-testid: 'next-button') to proceed. Upon clicking, the system checks if an option is selected: if correct, it increments the score by 1; if not selected, it proceeds without scoring. The system updates to the next question or, if none remain, hides the question, options, and button (by adding the 'hidden' class) and displays the final score in the <div> (data-testid: 'score') with the message 'You scored {score} out of {total number of questions}'.

test_case:
Feature: Quiz Navigation and Scoring
  The purpose of this feature is to ensure that when the user clicks the "Next Question" button, the system correctly calculates the score, updates the question index, and loads the next question if available.


  Scenario: [Normal] User clicks "Next Question" after selecting the correct answer
    Given the quiz page is loaded
    And the first question "What is the capital of France?" is displayed
    And the user selects the option "Paris" with data-testid "option-2"
    When the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"
    Then the next question "What is 2 + 2?" should be displayed

Feature: Quiz Navigation and Scoring
  The purpose of this feature is to ensure that when the user clicks the "Next Question" button, the system correctly calculates the score, updates the question index, and loads the next question if available.


Scenario: [Normal] User clicks "Next Question" after selecting an incorrect answer
    Given the quiz page is loaded
    And the first question "What is the capital of France?" is displayed
    And the user selects the option "Berlin" with data-testid "option-0"
    When the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"
    Then the next question "What is 2 + 2?" should be displayed

Feature: Quiz Navigation and Scoring
  The purpose of this feature is to ensure that when the user clicks the "Next Question" button, the system correctly calculates the score, updates the question index, and loads the next question if available.


Scenario: [Edge] User clicks "Next Question" without selecting any answer
    Given the quiz page is loaded
    And the first question "What is the capital of France?" is displayed
    And no option is selected
    When the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"
    Then the next question "What is 2 + 2?" should be displayed

requirement.description: When the user clicks the button with data-testid 'next-button' after answering or skipping the last question on the Online Quiz Portal, if all questions are completed, the system must hide the element with data-testid 'question', hide the element with data-testid 'options', hide the element with data-testid 'next-button', and display the element with data-testid 'score' showing the text 'You scored X out of Y'.

test_case:
Feature: Display Final Score After Completing All Questions
  The system should hide the question, options, and button elements, and display the final score when the user completes all questions and clicks the "Next Question" button.


Scenario: [Normal] User completes all questions and views final score  
  Given the "Online Quiz Portal" page is loaded  
  When the user selects the answer "Paris" with data-testid "option-2" on question 1
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  And the user selects the correct answer "4" with data-testid "option-1" on question 2
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  And the user selects the correct answer "Pacific Ocean" with data-testid "option-3" on question 3  
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  Then the element with data-testid "question" should be hidden  
  And the element with data-testid "options" should be hidden  
  And the element with data-testid "next-button" should be hidden  
  And the element with data-testid "score" should be visible  
  And the element with data-testid "score" should display "You scored 3 out of 3"

Feature: Display Final Score After Completing All Questions
  The system should hide the question, options, and button elements, and display the final score when the user completes all questions and clicks the "Next Question" button.


Scenario: [Normal] User completes all questions with incorrect answers  
  Given the "Online Quiz Portal" page is loaded  
  When the user selects the answer "Berlin" with data-testid "option-0" on question 1  
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  And the user selects the answer "5" with data-testid "option-2” on question 2  
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  And the user selects the answer "Atlantic Ocean" with data-testid "option-0” on question 3  
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  Then the element with data-testid "question" should be hidden  
  And the element with data-testid "options" should be hidden  
  And the element with data-testid "next-button" should be hidden  
  And the element with data-testid "score" should be visible  
  And the element with data-testid "score" should display "You scored 0 out of 3"

Feature: Display Final Score After Completing All Questions
  The system should hide the question, options, and button elements, and display the final score when the user completes all questions and clicks the "Next Question" button.


Scenario: [Error] User does not select an answer for the last question  
  Given the "Online Quiz Portal" page is loaded  
  When the user selects the answer "Paris" with data-testid "option-2” on question 1  
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  And the user selects the answer "4" with data-testid "option-1” on question 2  
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  And the user does not select any answer on question 3  
  And the user clicks the "Next Question" button with data-testid "next-button"  
  Then the element with data-testid "question" should not be visible
  And the element with data-testid "options" should not be visible
  And the element with data-testid "score" should be visible
  And the element with data-testid "score" should display "You scored 2 out of 3"
